meanings.definition: Changing in conjunction with something else.
meanings.sent1: The covariant colors of the chameleon help it blend into its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The temperature and humidity are covariant factors affecting plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The covariant dance moves of the duo impressed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was covariant with the weather, sunny when it was bright and gloomy when it rained.
meanings.sent5: The covariant relationship between supply and demand determines the market price.

meanings.sent1: The twins have covariant personalities, always thinking alike.
meanings.sent2: His actions were covariant with his beliefs, always honest and fair.
meanings.sent3: The covariant outfits of the couple made them look like a matching pair.
meanings.sent4: The detective found covariant clues pointing to the same suspect.
meanings.sent5: Their covariant interests in music brought them together as friends.

meanings.definition: A variable that changes in relation to another variable.
meanings.sent1: In the experiment, the speed of the car was a covariant to the distance traveled.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the covariant to understand its impact on the results.
meanings.sent3: The student's grades were a covariant of the effort put into studying.
meanings.sent4: The price of the product was a covariant in the decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project relied on identifying the covariant and controlling it.
